# Code of Conduct

## Our Commitment

We are committed to fostering an open, professional, and respectful environment for everyone who participates in this project.

We pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for all people, regardless of age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, level of experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity or orientation, or technical background.

We value constructive collaboration, technical integrity, and mutual respect.

---

## Expected Behavior

Participants in this project are expected to:

- Be respectful and professional in all interactions.
- Provide constructive feedback focused on the code or technical matter at hand.
- Assume good intent while remaining open to clarification.
- Respect differing viewpoints and experiences.
- Accept responsibility for mistakes and correct them promptly.
- Prioritize technical accuracy and project stability over personal preference.

---

## Unacceptable Behavior

The following behaviors are not tolerated:

- Harassment, intimidation, or discrimination of any kind.
- Personal attacks, insults, or inflammatory language.
- Trolling, baiting, or deliberately disruptive conduct.
- Publishing private information without consent.
- Repeatedly ignoring project guidelines or maintainer decisions.
- Any conduct that would reasonably be considered unprofessional or hostile.

---

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies to:

- Issues
- Pull requests
- Discussions
- Project documentation
- Community spaces directly associated with this repository

It also applies when representing this project in public forums or external communities.

---

## Enforcement

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying and enforcing this Code of Conduct.

Maintainers may take any action deemed appropriate in response to unacceptable behavior, including but not limited to:

- Warning the individual
- Removing content
- Locking threads
- Rejecting pull requests
- Temporarily or permanently banning contributors

Enforcement decisions are made at the discretion of the maintainers and are not subject to public debate.

---

## Reporting

If you experience or witness behavior that violates this Code of Conduct, please contact:

contact@nathanneurotic.com

All reports will be reviewed confidentially and handled in good faith.

---

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant (version 2.1), available at:
https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html

Modifications have been made to reflect the governance structure of this project.
